record_data.record_title: FERC Electric Tariff Vol No. 5 WDAT
record_data.record_plain_text:
EVERGY METRO, INC., FERC ELECTRIC TARIFF, VOL. NO. 5 WHOLESALE DISTRIBUTION ACCESS TARIFF
WHOLESALE DISTRIBUTION ACCESS TARIFF I. PROVISION OF SERVICE Evergy Metro, Inc. (Evergy or Company) will provide Wholesale Distribution Access Service (WDAS) in accordance with this Wholesale Distribution Access Tariff designated as FERC Electric Tariff, Volume No. 5 (WDAT or Tariff). II. AVAILABILITY OF SERVICE A. Service Availability WDAS under this Tariff only includes service over Companys distribution system as defined in accordance with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commissions (FERCs) seven-factor test set forth in Order No. 888 (the Distribution System) for Customers (as defined below) interconnected at voltage levels designated as Primary or Secondary pursuant to Companys distribution standards. To the extent Customers purchase, sale, or movement of power requires the use of infrastructure outside of Companys Distribution System, Customer must obtain service separately through the owner or operator of that infrastructure, as appropriate. WDAS is applicable to any Company customer (Customer) who: (1) Owns or controls a generator or an energy storage system (ESS) that (a) will be used primarily to provide wholesale energy service(s) in the Southwest Power Pool, Inc.s (SPPs) Integrated Marketplace (IM), either directly or through an aggregation, or to conduct wholesale transactions on the Distribution System and (b) will not be fundamentally used for its own individual load or to serve retail customers; (2) Does not use the generator or ESS to (a) provide any retail energy service(s) to Company, or (b) participate in a retail customer generation program(s) approved by the Kansas Corporation Commission (KCC) or Missouri Public Service Commission (MoPSC), as applicable; (3) Meets Companys creditworthiness requirements set forth herein; and (4) Executes a Service Agreement for WDAS (Service Agreement) pursuant to Appendix B under this Tariff or requests in writing that Company file a proposed unexecuted Service Agreement with FERC. Providers of wholesale energy services using Evergys Distribution System prior to the effective date of this Tariff will not be required to obtain WDAS. Resources interconnected to Distribution System facilities by providers of wholesale energy services already subject to a wholesale distribution service charge for such facilities prior to the effective date of this Tariff also will not be required to obtain WDAS so long as that resource continues to pay the applicable wholesale distribution service charge. B. Procedures for Arranging WDAS A prospective Customer requesting WDAS whose generator or ESS is not yet interconnected to Companys Distribution System must submit an application to Company in accordance with Companys applicable distribution interconnection procedures and indicate at the time of such application that it will engage primarily in wholesale transactions and take service pursuant to this Tariff. Each Customer generator and ESS must comply with Companys applicable technical standards and any metering requirements identified under Companys distribution interconnection procedures. Customer shall be responsible for the costs incurred by Company for the purchase, installation, operation, maintenance, testing, repair, and replacement of metering and data acquisition equipment, in accordance with applicable state tariffs and the Service Agreement. Customer shall be responsible for arranging for any retail service required for on-site load in accordance with Companys state tariffs. Company reserves the right to defer providing WDAS if distribution facilities or upgrades are needed to provide WDAS or if WDAS would, without such new facilities or upgrades, impair or degrade the reliability or safety of any existing distribution services. III. TERMS OF SERVICE A. Overview WDAS entails the delivery of electric energy from Customers generator or ESS over the Distribution System and, in the case of Customers ESS, the transport of electric energy over the Distribution System that is stored for later resale by the ESS (Wholesale Charging), in accordance with the rates, terms, and conditions specified in this Tariff and Customers Service Agreement. B. Term and Termination WDAS shall be effective as of the date indicated in Customers Service Agreement and shall be effective for a minimum of one (1) year. WDAS under Customers Service Agreement shall remain in effect until terminated in accordance with its terms. IV. TARIFF CHARGES Customer shall pay Company a monthly Wholesale Distribution Access Charge (WDAC) for WDAS, including, if applicable, a monthly charge for Wholesale Charging. Customers taking service under this Tariff shall be charged in accordance with the rates described below and set forth in Appendix A. A. Wholesale Distribution Access Charge The WDAC will be a fixed monthly charge applied uniformly across all WDAS Customers based on each Customers voltage level (i.e., Primary or Secondary, pursuant to Companys distribution standards). Customer shall pay the monthly WDAC for Companys delivery of electric energy produced by Customer from Customers premises over Companys Distribution System. The amount of energy delivered shall not exceed the maximum delivery quantity (MDQ) set forth in Customers Service Agreement. Customer shall schedule the deliveries of that energy in accordance with the then-effective procedures of SPP and Company. B. Wholesale Charging Customers with an ESS engaging in Wholesale Charging shall be charged in accordance with the rates set forth in Appendix A. Charges for Wholesale Charging shall be applied uniformly across all applicable Customers taking service under this Tariff and based on each Customers voltage level (i.e., Primary or Secondary). The amount of energy received shall not exceed the maximum import quantity (MIQ) set forth in Customers Service Agreement. V. CUSTOMER OBLIGATIONS A. Creditworthiness For the purpose of determining the ability of Customer to meet its obligations related to service hereunder, Company may require reasonable credit review procedures in accordance with standard commercial practices and the credit requirements specified in the Companys Rules and Regulations tariffs for retail electric service (Rules and Regulations) for the Customers applicable state tariff, and Customers Service Agreement. B. Billing and Payment Company will provide Customer a bill once each billing period pursuant to the billing and payment provisions in the Companys Rules and Regulations. C. Participation Responsibilities Customers participation under this Tariff must at all times comply with all applicable reliability and safety requirements, including any applicable North American Electric Reliability Corporation requirements or standards, and all applicable laws and regulations, including the governing documents of SPP. Customer acknowledges and agrees that Company may require it to cease or alter its participation under this Tariff for operational or safety reasons. Customer agrees to take all actions necessary to comply with such directives and acknowledges that Company is not responsible for the impact of those directives on Customers wholesale transactions. VI. OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS A. Limitation of Liability Evergy will endeavor at all times to provide WDAS under this Tariff in a regular and uninterrupted manner. But if such service is interrupted or irregular, or fails because of circumstances beyond Evergys control or the ordinary negligence of its employees, servants, or agents, Evergy will not be liable therefore. Any liability that Evergy might bear for service interruptions under other circumstances shall not include indirect, incidental, punitive, special, or consequential damages. B. Force Majeure Evergy or Customer shall not be considered to violate any obligation under this Tariff if prevented from fulfilling the obligation due to an event of Force Majeure. If Evergys or Customers performance is hindered by an event of Force Majeure, it shall make all reasonable efforts to perform its obligations under this Tariff and the relevant Service Agreement. A party claiming Force Majeure shall provide written notice to the other party as soon as practicable after such event occurs. Upon the conclusion of the event of Force Majeure, the party relying on it shall, within a reasonable time, take all necessary steps to resume the obligation previously suspended. Any partys obligation to make payments already owing shall not be suspended by an event of Force Majeure. Force Majeure is defined as any act of God, labor disturbance, act of the public enemy, war, insurrection, riot, fire, storm, or flood; explosion, breakage, or accident to machinery or equipment; any curtailment, order, regulation, or restriction imposed by governmental military or lawfully established civilian authorities; or any other cause beyond a partys control. A Force Majeure event does not include an act of negligence or intentional wrongdoing. C. Indemnification Customer shall, to the extent permitted by law, indemnify, defend, and save Company harmless from any and all damages, losses, claims (including claims and actions relating to injury to or death of any person or damage to property), demands, suits, recoveries, costs and expenses, court costs, attorney fees, and all other obligations by or to third parties arising out of or resulting from Companys performance of its obligations under this Tariff on behalf of Customer, except in cases of negligence or intentional wrongdoing by Company. D. Reservation of Rights Company shall have the right at any time to make a unilateral filing with FERC to modify this Tariff with respect to any rates, terms and conditions, charges, classifications of service, rule or regulation under Section 205 or any other applicable provision of the Federal Power Act and FERCs rules and regulations thereunder. Company shall have the right at any time to amend its retail rate tariffs to reflect changes to its distribution service rates or other state-approved distribution service rates in accordance with the applicable statutes and rules and regulations of the KCC or MoPSC, as applicable. Nothing contained in this Tariff or any Service Agreement shall be construed as affecting in any way the right of Company to unilaterally make application to FERC for a change in rates, terms, conditions, charges, classifications of service, Service Agreement, or rule or regulation under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act and pursuant to FERCs rules and regulations promulgated thereunder. Nothing contained in this Tariff or any Service Agreement shall be construed as affecting in any way the ability of any Customer receiving service under this Tariff to exercise its rights under the Federal Power Act and pursuant to FERCs rules and regulations promulgated thereunder. E. Dispute Resolution Any dispute between a Customer and Company shall be resolved by the dispute resolution procedures as specified in the Companys Rules and Regulations; provided, however, that a dispute that relates directly to applications for rate or other changes to the WDAT, or to a Service Agreement entered into thereunder, that cannot be resolved between Company and Customer shall be presented to FERC for resolution. Company and Customer may also contact FERCs Dispute Resolution Service for assistance in resolving the dispute.
WHOLESALE DISTRIBUTION ACCESS TARIFF APPENDIX A STATEMENT OF RATES
Service Territory Primary Distribution Secondary Distribution
WDAC ($/kW) WDAC Wholesale Charging Component ($/kW) WDAC ($/kW) WDAC Wholesale Charging Component ($/kW) Evergy Metro, Inc. (Kansas) 4.23 4.23 3.76 3.76 Evergy Metro, Inc. (Missouri) 7.13 7.13 4.33 4.33
These rates apply to voltage levels designated as Primary or Secondary pursuant to Companys distribution standards. These rates shall be revised periodically to reflect changes to Companys retail rates.
WHOLESALE DISTRIBUTION ACCESS TARIFF APPENDIX B PRO FORMA SERVICE AGREEMENT
SERVICE AGREEMENT FOR WHOLESALE DISTRIBUTION ACCESS SERVICE This Wholesale Distribution Service Agreement (Agreement), dated ___________ __, 20__, between Evergy Metro, Inc. (Evergy or Company), a Missouri corporation having an office at 1200 Main Street, Kansas City, MO 64105, and ___________________ (Customer), a ____________ corporation, having an office at ___________________________________, (collectively, Parties). WITNESSES WHEREAS, Evergy owns and operates an electric distribution system (the Distribution System) in a franchised service area in Kansas and Missouri; WHEREAS, Evergy uses that system to provide retail electric sales service pursuant to Rules and Regulations and rates on file with the Kansas Corporation Commission (KCC) or the Missouri Public Service Commission (MoPSC); WHEREAS, the Southwest Power Pool, Inc. (SPP) exercises operational control over transmission facilities in Kansas and Missouri in accordance with an Open Access Transmission Tariff and administers markets for the sale and purchase of electric capacity, energy, and ancillary services; WHEREAS, Customer owns and operates a generator or an energy storage system (ESS) that is connected to the Distribution System; WHEREAS, Customer intends to use the Distribution System to engage in wholesale transactions and requires delivery service over the Distribution System for same; WHEREAS, Evergy agrees to provide that delivery service (Wholesale Distribution Access Service or WDAS) in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement and the provisions of Evergys Wholesale Distribution Access Tariff, FERC Electric Tariff, Vol. No. 5 (Tariff or WDAT). NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and mutual promises stated herein, Evergy and Customer agree as follows.
ARTICLE I GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS
1.1 Incorporation by Reference
Except as is otherwise expressly provided herein, this Agreement incorporates by reference the terms and conditions of any applicable tariffs that may be approved by FERC, including the WDAT, and the MoPSC or KCC, as applicable, as such tariffs may be amended or superseded from time to time. In the event of any conflict between the terms of this Agreement and those of such tariffs, the terms of this Agreement shall govern with respect to matters provided herein.
1.2 Reservation of Rights
Company shall have the right at any time to make a unilateral filing with FERC to modify the Tariff with respect to any rates, terms and conditions, charges, classifications of service, rule or regulation under Section 205 or any other applicable provision of the Federal Power Act and FERCs rules and regulations thereunder. Company shall have the right at any time to amend its retail rate tariffs to reflect changes to its distribution service rates or other state-approved distribution service rates in accordance with the rules and regulations of the MoPSC or KCC, as applicable. Nothing contained in the Tariff or any Service Agreement shall be construed as affecting in any way the right of the Company to unilaterally make application to FERC for a change in rates, terms, conditions, charges, classification of service, Service Agreement, rule or regulation under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act and pursuant to FERCs rules and regulations promulgated thereunder. Nothing contained in the Tariff or any Service Agreement shall be construed as affecting in any way the ability of any Customer receiving service under this Tariff to exercise its rights under the Federal Power Act and pursuant to FERCs rules and regulations promulgated thereunder.
1.3 Term
This Agreement is effective as of the date first written above and shall remain in effect until Customer permanently discontinues wholesale energy and other wholesale market transactions into the SPP-administered wholesale electric markets and to third parties or until this Agreement is terminated in accordance with its terms.
1.4 Termination
This Agreement may be terminated (i) by Customer at any time and for any reason upon one hundred and twenty (120) days prior written notice to Evergy, (ii) by Evergy upon breach by Customer of any term of this Tariff after thirty (30) days prior written notice to Customer by filing at FERC for such termination, unless Customer cures its breach within the thirty (30) day notice period, (iii) by mutual agreement of the Parties, or (iv) by an order of FERC.
ARTICLE II CUSTOMER OBLIGATIONS
2.1 Creditworthiness
For the purpose of determining the ability of Customer to meet its obligations related to WDAS, Company may require reasonable credit review procedures. This review shall be made in accordance with standard commercial practices and the credit requirements as specified in Companys Rules and Regulations. In addition, Evergy may require Customer to provide and maintain in effect during the term of this Agreement, a form of security acceptable to the Company and consistent with commercial practices to meet its responsibilities and obligations under the WDAT. Company will determine on a nondiscriminatory basis whether security will be required. Absent a material adverse change in the creditworthiness of Customer, security will not be required where Customer has previously established its creditworthiness pursuant to a tariff, rate schedule, or service contract for service provided by Company, and has not defaulted on its obligation under that applicable tariff or rate schedule.
2.2 Payments
Customer shall pay to Evergy all charges assessed to Customer pursuant to the Tariff. Company will provide Customer a bill once each billing period pursuant to the billing and payment provisions in Companys Rules and Regulations.
2.3 Representations and Warranties
Customer represents and warrants that the information in the attached Customer Information Form is correct. Customer will promptly inform Evergy of any changes in such information.
ARTICLE III MISCELLANEOUS
3.1 Resolution of Disputes
Disputes arising with respect to matters under this Agreement will be resolved pursuant to Section VI of the Tariff.
3.2 Notices
Any notice to be given by Customer or Evergy to each other hereunder will be deemed given, and any other document to be delivered hereunder will be deemed delivered, if in writing and (i) delivered by hand, (ii) deposited for next-business day delivery (fee prepaid) with a reputable overnight delivery service such as Federal Express, or (iii) mailed by certified mail (return receipt requested) postage prepaid, addressed to the recipient at the address set forth below for that party (or at such other address as that party may from time to time designate by giving notice thereof):
To Evergy: Evergy Metro, Inc. ______________________________ ______________________________ ______________________________ Attention: _____________________ Phone No.: ____________________ To Customer: ________________________________ ________________________________ ________________________________ Attention: _______________________ Phone No.: ______________________
3.3 Amendments
Notwithstanding any provision of this Agreement, Evergy may, unilaterally and at any time, propose and file with the FERC changes to the rates, terms, and conditions of the WDAT and/or to the MoPSC or KCC, as applicable, for changes to the rates, terms, and conditions of service provided under a retail tariff. Such amendment or modification will become effective with respect to service pursuant to this Agreement on the date specified by the FERC and/or the MoPSC or KCC, as applicable.
3.4 Prior Agreements Superseded
This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the parties hereto with respect to the subject matter hereof, supersedes any and all previous understandings between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof, and binds and inures to the benefit of the parties, their successors and permitted assigns.
3.5 Waiver and Modification
No modification or waiver of all or any part of this Agreement will be valid unless in writing and signed by the parties hereto. Any waiver will be effective only for the particular event for which it is issued and will not be deemed a waiver with respect to any subsequent performance, default, or matter.
3.6 Operations and Safety Considerations
Customer acknowledges and agrees that Evergy may direct Customer to cease or alter its activities under the WDAT and this Agreement for operational or safety reasons. Customer agrees to take all actions necessary to comply with such directives.
3.7 Applicable Law and Forum
Interpretation and performance of this Agreement will be in accordance with, and will be controlled by, the laws of the state of the Forum State, except its conflict of laws provisions to the extent they would require the application of the laws of any other jurisdiction. Customer irrevocably consents that any legal action or proceeding arising under or relating to this Agreement will be brought in a court of the Forum State or a federal court of the United States of America located in the Forum State. Customer irrevocably waives any objection that it may now or in the future have to the Forum State as the proper and exclusive forum for any legal action or proceeding arising under or relating to this Agreement. The Forum State is the state in which the service territory in which WDAS is provided is located (that is, Kansas for Evergy Metros Kansas service territory and Missouri for Evergy Metros Missouri service territory).
3.8 Severability
If one or more provisions herein will be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable in any respect it will be given effect to the extent permitted by applicable law, and such invalidity, illegality, or unenforceability will not affect the validity of the other provisions of this Agreement.
3.9 Agency
This Agreement is not intended, and will not be construed, to create any association, joint venture, agency relationship, or partnership between Evergy and Customer or to impose any such obligation or liability upon Evergy.
3.10 Not for the Benefit of Non-Parties
This Agreement is for the benefit of Customer and Evergy and is not for the benefit of third parties.
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, Evergy and Customer have executed this Agreement as of the date first written above.
Evergy Metro, Inc. Customer: _________________
By: _______________________ By: ______________________ Name: Name Title: Title
